tournament.name: Monday 3rd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent with cards like Zenith Flare. Key cards like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer benefit from cycling, while Drannith Healer and Drannith Stinger help gain life and deal damage respectively. The deck also includes cards like Improbable Alliance and Frostveil Ambush to generate tokens and control the board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of creatures and burn spells while efficiently cycling through the deck for necessary resources.

The deck focuses on utilizing high value cards and control spells to outvalue the opponent, while also maintaining a strong board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It aims to generate card advantage through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also using removal spells like Heartless Act and Oath of Kaya to control the board. The deck also has access to ramp spells like Growth Spiral and powerful finishers like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to close out the game.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, allowing the player to control the game by playing powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Deafening Clarion, and Sphinx of Foresight. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to finish off the opponent. The overall strategy is to control the board while setting up a powerful end game with big creatures and game-changing spells.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Robber of the Rich, Priest of Forgotten Gods, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, while also utilizing Sacrifice synergies with cards like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar. The goal is to quickly build a board presence, deal damage to the opponent, and disrupt their strategy by taking advantage of the graveyard with cards like Call of the Death-Dweller. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful Companion option that allows for additional value and recursion throughout the game.

This aggressive Rakdos deck focuses on maximizing damage output by utilizing sacrifice effects and small creatures. The presence of Obosh as a companion ensures that odd-damage sources deal even more damage. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Claim the Firstborn and sacrifice synergies with Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar while chipping away at the opponent's life total with creatures like Mayhem Devil and Gutterbones. The strategy revolves around dealing consistent damage and overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and recursion to generate value and pressure on the opponent. By combining cards like Claim the Firstborn, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods with creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, the deck aims to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total with continuous pressure. The synergy between sacrificing, recurring, and dealing damage makes it difficult for opponents to stabilize and allows the deck to maintain tempo and aggression throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while generating mana with Wilderness Reclamation to cast big spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. Utilizing ramp and card draw spells like Growth Spiral and Opt, the deck aims to efficiently ramp into powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. With a mix of counter magic, removal, card draw, and powerful win conditions, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents in a game of attrition.

This control deck focuses on maximizing card advantage and board control through a combination of counter spells, removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck can capitalize on the extra value generated by blinking permanents. Overall, the deck's key strategy revolves around controlling the game, generating incremental advantage, and overwhelming the opponent with powerful late-game plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's moves by utilizing a variety of removal spells and disruptive cards like Thought Erasure, Cry of the Carnarium, and Dovin's Veto. It also includes powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Shark Typhoon, while also maintaining board presence with cards like Oath of Kaya and Elspeth Conquers Death.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention to cast powerful creatures and spells for free. The deck includes a mix of aggressive threats like Questing Beast and Embercleave, along with resilient creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Cavalier of Thorns. Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provides card advantage and mana ramp, while Kaheera, the Orphanguard acts as a companion for additional synergy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact plays while maintaining control of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through Fires of Invention to cheat out high-cost spells and creatures while preventing opponents from casting spells at instant speed with Teferi, Time Raveler. Utilizing a mix of removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Bonecrusher Giant, along with creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Cubwarden for pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion adds card advantage to ensure a steady stream of resources throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to play powerful spells for free, establishing control over the game by managing the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Cavalier of Flame. The deck also utilizes Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion for card advantage. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Kenrith, the Returned King and Shark Typhoon, while controlling the game with counterspells and card draw from Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly deploy a board presence of aggressive creatures and use sacrificing synergies to drain the opponent's life total. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Gutterbones, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven, the deck aims to deal damage consistently each turn while maintaining a resource advantage. With the addition of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck enhances its damage potential, making it even more challenging for opponents to keep up with the relentless assault. The deck's strategy revolves around quick and efficient aggression, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and graveyard recursion to pressure the opponent quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods, Cauldron Familiar, and Claim the Firstborn, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Dreadhorde Butcher, along with disruptive spells like Agonizing Remorse, the deck builds early pressure while maintaining card advantage. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides extra sustainability and value throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive tactics to quickly overwhelm opponents with low-cost creatures and sacrifice synergies. Using cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to generate value from sacrificing creatures for various effects while pressuring the opponent's life total. Additionally, utilizing the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows the deck to have a consistent source of card advantage and recursion. The goal is to maintain a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around dealing damage quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent. By including cards like Mayhem Devil, Judith, the Scourge Diva, and Obosh, the Preypiercer, it aims to maximize damage output with each creature played. Utilizing synergies between creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven, along with sacrificing effects like Woe Strider, the deck can control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing to ensure a consistent and aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly and taking advantage of the powerful abilities of cards like Omnath, Uro, and Risen Reef. By utilizing cards that allow for extra land drops and mana acceleration, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and generate extra value with cards like Cavalier of Thorns and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional synergy and allows for more flexibility in how the deck can be built and played. The goal is to put pressure on opponents early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. Uro serves as a powerful threat and source of card advantage while Shark Typhoon can create a constant stream of threats. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with efficient spells, card draw, and powerful late-game threats like Expansion / Explosion. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the three colors of the Temur wedge while ensuring consistent access to all necessary colors.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to manage the game state while ramping up mana for powerful spells and card draw. It includes counterspells, removal, and card draw to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The main win condition is generating a large board presence with Shark Typhoon, supported by Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Expansion / Explosion for additional reach and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, ramp up mana quickly, and overwhelm them with powerful threats.
